ai.question: Which three descriptions accurately define the concept of a pilot network? (Choose three.)

choice.text: user traffic not affected by changes
not as easily controlled as a prototype network

ai.question: When building a prototype to test a network design, why is it important to create a test plan before beginning the process?

choice.text: to ensure that the goals of the test are clear and measurable
to record a baseline of network activity on the production network
to provide a step-by-step guide for implementation of the network design
to ensure that network resources are adequate to support additional traffic generated by the test

ai.question: What is a common way of load balancing traffic over redundant links?
A network administrator is testing the redundant links between switches. What state will the redundant link reach after the active link is disconnected?
A network designer wishes to add another server to the current network. What risk does the designer avoid by implementing two servers?

A new company will have several buildings and use the network for voice, video, and data. Two proposals have been made:

1. Use a flat switched network design to connect all the buildings and a single router for Internet access.
2. Use a hierarchical infrastructure with switches at the Access Layer and routers for data transport between buildings and Internet access. Which statement about the competing designs is correct?

choice.text: Proposal 2 is only adequate for data traffic.
Proposal 1 works well for video, but not VoIP.

ai.question: Which Cisco switching protocol provides resiliency when a network experiences connectivity problems and ensures near 100% uptime?

A web content hosting company has been granted a new contract to host an online ordering service for a large retail chain. The content hosting company asks a networking consulting firm to examine the current network infrastructure to prepare for the launch of the online ordering service. The examination reveals that the content hosting company has two T1 lines connected to two separate ISPs. The server farm provides each customer with a separate web server. Each server is running Linux with Apache on one 30-gigabyte hard disk.

What are the two greatest potential risks in the current network infrastructure of the content hosting company? (Choose two.)

choice.text: single point of failure of the web server
large failure domain if the web server fails
potential bottlenecks on the Internet connection
single point of failure if their ISP fails to provide the connection
limited scalability of web servers due to their hard disk capacity

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. Port Fa0/0 on router R1 is connected to port Fa0/1 on switch S1. After the commands shown are entered on both devices, the network administrator determines that the devices on VLAN 2 are unable to ping the devices on VLAN 5. What is the likely problem?

choice.text: S1 is not configured for trunking.
R1 does not have the VLANs entered in the VLAN database.
Spanning Tree Protocol is blocking port Fa0/0 on R1.
The VLANs do not match the subinterface numbers.
